attributes.action: Secondary School exams to have the option of being taken orally
attributes.additional_details:
As a secondary school student currently undertaking my A-Levels, I believe that students should reserve the right to determine how their exams should be administered.
We are a society of individuals, each with our capabilities, qualities and limitations - so allow us to pick the option that would capitalise on these attributes the best. In doing so, you would ensure that the next generation are privy to their desired avenues' of Academic success - helping thousands attain grades that they otherwise would have been deemed 'incapable of.'

Students should have the options of taking written or oral exams, with variations for each. One could decide whether to take multiple or single exams, for example.
